results.title: Air!
results.creator_credit: Paul Driessen, Pierre Moretti and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This animated short makes the point that oxygen is the stuff of life whether on land, in the air or water, but that it is becoming scarcer as man-made pollutants crowd it out. It is a film without words in which plants, birds, fish and, finally, man come to the same ‘breathless’ end. (Awards: San Francisco, Belgrade)

results.title: Albino alligator
results.creator_credit: Kevin Spacey, Brad Jenkel, Steve Stabler, Brad Krevoy and Motion Picture Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Kevin Spacey makes his directorial debut with “Albino alligator”, a tense and claustrophobic thriller. A robbery goes wrong for three petty crims (Gary Sinise, Matt Dillon, William Fichtner), when a shootout results in the death of a federal agent. They flee to Dino’s Last Chance Bar, a New Orleans basement dive. Their attempt to lay low and maintain anonymity is abruptly shattered when government agents, camera crews and a SWAT team surround the building. The stalemate causes the crooks, patrons and bar employees to react to the situation in unexpected and dramatic ways, contributing to the films tense drama. Also starring Faye Dunaway, Skeet Ulrich, M. Emmet Walsh and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: Alberta girls
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Malca Gillson, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film follows the Alberta All-girls drum and bugle band at the opening ceremonies of the World Cup Soccer Championship at Munich, Olympic Stadium, and their tour around Germany.

results.title: Albert Camus
results.brief_description:
Albert Camus, born in Mondovi (Algeria) on 7 November 1913, earned a worldwide reputation as a novelist and essayist and won the Nobel Prize for literature in 1957. Through his writing, and in some measure against his will, he became the leading moral voice of his generation during the 1950s. At the height of his fame, Camus died in an automobile accident in 1960. This documentary, made for TV, discusses his work and in particular his relationship to the Algerian landscape. Contains interviews with Jules Roy, Mouloud Mammeri, Francis Jeanson, Jean Pellegri and Pascal Piat.

Credits: Producer, Cecile Clairval ; director, Paul Vecchiali ; photography, Jacques Duhamel.
Cast: Julien Guiomar, Djelloul Beghoura [narration only].

results.title: Aladin et la Lampe Merveilleuse
results.brief_description:
A magician, famous for his tricks, is conjuring all the genies in order to find the marvellous lamp and become master of the world.

Credits: Producer, Raymond Gautreau ; director, Jean Image ; writers, France and Jean Image ; photography, Per Olaf Csongova ; music, Fred Freed.
Cast: Gaston Guez, Henri Virlojeux, Claire Guibert, Rene Hieronimus, Lucie Dolene, Fred Pasquali [voices only].

results.title: Akira [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Katsuhiro Otomo, Shunzo Kato, Ryohei Suzuki and Akira Committee
results.brief_description: Akira is set in Neo-Tokyo, 2019. The city is rebuilding after World War III. Kaneda and Tetsuo, two high-school dropouts, are members of a joy-riding motorcycle gang. They stumble upon a secret government project to develop telekinetic humans, apparently for use as weapons. The most powerful of these subjects is Akira, a being shrouded in mystery. The film is based on the popular graphic novel of the same name, which has achieved cult status in Japan. Animation and visual effects are outstanding in this spectacular and often disturbing vision of urban apocalypse. NB: THIS IS NOT A CHILDRENS’ FEATURE AND IS RECOMMENDED FOR MATURE AUDIENCES.

constellations_other.name: Future forward; cyberpunk manifestations, fantasy and world building
constellations_other.description: Science fiction and cyberpunk are often powerful projections of the future, which may act as dystopic warnings or strive for an optimistic outcome where societies rise above adversity.

results.title: Airhawk: star of the north
results.creator_credit: David Baker, Colin Eggleston, Ron McLean and Ron McLean Productions
results.brief_description: Jim Hawk, outback pilot and adventurer, is wanted by a group of international diamond dealers. When he starts investigating his brother’s murder, Hawk finds himself on the hit list. Conspiracy and murder follow him from Hong Kong to the Gold Coast and then to outback Queensland, as Hawk struggles to uncover the ringleaders and avenge his brother’s death. Based on the cartoon series created by John Dixon the film stars Eric Oldfield and Louise Howitt.

results.title: Air parade: a Shell film for the Festival of Britain 1951
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A brief history of aviation in Britain commencing with Bleriot’s crossing of the Channel in 1909 and ending with the development of the gas-turbine airliner. This film traces the development of both military and civil aircraft including the Viscount turbo-jet and the Comet.

results.title: Air Force One
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Jonathan Shestack, Gail Katz, Armyan Bernstein and Buena Vista International
results.brief_description: Cementing his status as action hero leading man, Harrison Ford plays the United States President who also happens to be a Vietnam War hero. Trapped aboard his private jet, President Marshall must display a steely reserve in the face of unhinged kidnappers. Peterson (In the Line of Fire, The Perfect Storm, Troy) ably directs this mainstream thriller that produces a tangle of twists but lacks the enormous tension generated by his classic wartime nail-biter “Das Boot”. Cast also includes Gary Oldman, Wendy Crewson, Paul Guilfoyle, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell, William H. Macy.
